name: Ruby EventEmitter
body:
## INSTALL:

    % gem install event_emitter

## REQUIREMENTS:

* Ruby 1.8.7+
* Ruby 1.9.3+
* JRuby 1.6.7+

## SYNOPSIS:

### setup

load rubygem

````ruby
require "rubygems"
require "event_emitter"
````

include

````ruby
class User
  include EventEmitter
  attr_accessor :name
end
````

### on/emit

regist event listener

````ruby
user = User.new
user.name = "shokai"
user.on :go do |data|
  puts "#{name} go to #{data[:place]}"
end
````

call event

````ruby
user.emit :go, {:place => "mountain"}
# => "shokai go to mountain"
````

### once

regist event using "once"

````ruby
user.once :eat do |data|
  puts "#{name} -> #{data}"
end
````

call only first time

````ruby
user.emit :eat, "BEEF"  # =>  "shokai -> BEEF"
user.emit :eat, "Ramen"  # => do not call.
````

### Instance-Specific Method

apply as instance-specific method

````ruby
class Foo
end

foo = Foo.new
EventEmitter.apply foo
````

### More Samples

* https://github.com/shokai/event_emitter/tree/master/samples
tagline: Ruby port of EventEmitter from Node.js
